revision.comment: Rescuing 1 sources and tagging 0 as dead.) #IABot (v2.0

{{Infobox artist discography | Artist = Nena | Image = Nena beim 50. Havelfest in Brandenburg an der Havel.jpg | Caption = Nena at the 50th Havelfest in [[Brandenburg an der Havel]] in 2013. | Alt = | Studio = 19 | Live = 7 | Compilation = 18 | EP = | Singles = 69 | Soundtrack = 2 | 1Option = 9 | 1Option name = Children's albums }} This is the discography of German pop singer [[Nena]].Unless otherwise stated, '''German (DE)''' album chart positions are from [http://www.officialcharts.de/ Media Control GfK International GmbH.] '''Austrian (AT)''' chart positions are from [http://austriancharts.at/showinterpret.asp?interpret=Nena Austriancharts.at.] '''Swiss (CH)''' album chart positions are from [http://swisscharts.com/artist/Nena Swisscharts.ch.] Chart positions for the '''Netherlands (NL)''', '''Sweden (SE)''', '''Belgium (BE)''' and '''Norway (NO)''' are also from [http://swisscharts.com/artist/Nena Swisscharts.ch.] '''United Kingdom (UK)''' album chart positions are from the [http://www.officialcharts.com/archive/music/ Official Charts Company Archive.] '''United States (US)''' album chart positions are from [http://www.allmusic.com/artist/nena-mn0000395187/awards Allmusic.] All data retrieved 3 October 2013 and 31 January 2015. ==Studio albums== ===The Stripes=== *1980: ''[[The Stripes]]'' ===Nena (band)=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" border="1" |+ List of albums, with selected chart positions and certifications ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:16em;"| Album details ! scope="col" colspan="4"| Peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| [[List of music recording certifications|Certifications]]{{cite web|last1=German certifications |title=Gold, Platium and Diamond Award [Insert "Nena" in "Interpret" field and click on "Suchen"] |url=http://www.musikindustrie.de/no_cache/gold_platin_datenbank/#topSearch |website=Musikindustrie.de |publisher=Bundesverbrand Musikindustrie (BVMI) |accessdate=11 June 2015 |ref=[Insert "Nena" in "Interpret" field and click on "Suchen"] |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151124171739/http://www.musikindustrie.de/no_cache/gold_platin_datenbank/ |archivedate=24 November 2015 }}{{cite web|last1=French certifications |title=Info disc - les certifications [Click on "Les albums/artiste" in "Les certifications" box, then choose "Nena" in "Choisir un artiste..."] |url=http://www.infodisc.fr/CD_Certif.php |website=infodisc.fr |publisher=Syndicat National de l'Édition Phonographique |accessdate=11 June 2015 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090601152354/http://www.infodisc.fr/CD_Certif.php |archivedate=1 June 2009 }} |- ! Nena]]''Both versions of ''Nena feat. Nena'' – the ''Rotes Album'' (2002) and the ''Blaues Album'' (2003) – charted in Germany, and both reached No. 2. See [http://musicline.de/de/chartverfolgung_summary/artist/Nena/18703/?type=longplay Nena Longplay-Chartverfolgung], Musicline.de. Retrieved 3 October 2013. It was the ''Rotes Album'' that charted in Austria and Switzerland, and the ''Blaues Album'' that charted in the Netherlands. | * Released: 28 October 2002 * Label: [[Warner Bros. Rabatz'' *2002: ''Tausend Sterne'' *2002: ''Madou und das Licht der Fantasie'' *2008: ''Himmel, Sonne, Wind und Regen'' *2008: ''Dein Herz für Kinder'' (with Peter Maffay and Rolf Zuckowski) — DE: 82 *2014: ''Die 1x1 CD mit den Hits von Nena'' (with Lisa, Leni and Malin) — DE: 78 ==Compilation albums== * 1991: ''Tanz auf dem Vulkan'' * 1991: ''[[Nena Die Band (album)|Nena: Die Band]]'' * 1996: ''Nena: Definitive Collection'' — DE: 64 * 1998: ''Nur geträumt: Ihre größten Erfolge'' — DE: 23 – AT: 16 – CH: 72 * 1999: ''Simply the Best: Nena'' * 2000: ''Leuchtturm'' * 2000: ''Hit Collection: Nena'' * 2000: ''Nena: Nur das Beste'' * 2003: ''Star Boulevard: Nena'' * 2003: ''Alles gute: Die Singles 1982–2002'' (2-CD Set) — DE: 65 – AT: 19 – CH: 49 * 2004: ''Einmal ist keinmal'' (2-CD Set) * 2004: ''Maxis and Mixes'' * 2004: ''Irgendwie, irgendwo, irgendwann'' * 2006: ''Alles ...''
